intro: Stahlia, commonly known as the "cloud flower," is a genus of flowering plants native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. Stahlia species are typically found in high-altitude, humid environments, thriving in cool, shaded conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and plant enthusiasts alike.
